result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron G. Nielsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:36pm
INCLUDES 15CM700, 15CM1070, 15CM1077, 16CF10
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Deft appears in person with Atty Austin Mort 
Date and time set for plea in 15CM700, 15CM1070, and 15CM1077 & preliminary hearing in 16CF10

Preliminary Hearing - 16CF10:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM700:
Ct. 2 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> D&RI
15CM1070:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> D&RI
15CM1077:
Ct. 1 OWI (4th) is amended to OWI (5th) which is new case 16CF10
Ct. 2 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> D&RI
16CF10:
Ct. 2 Operating with prohibited alcohol concentration - 5th offense >> dismissed outright
Ct. 3 Operate motor vehicle while revoked >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Misdemeanor Bail Jumping >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM700:
Ct. 1 OWI (4th) >> GUILTY
16CF10:
Ct. 1 OWI (5th) >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM700 Ct. 1- w/hold sentencing. Probation 2 years. CONDITIONS: Pay $1959 fine inclusive to court costs. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. 60 days MCJ, which deft has credit for time already. 26 months drivers license revocation, granted administraive credit for any time already served. 26 months interlock device to be installed immediately, time will not begin until obtains valid drivers license. Complete AODA assessment with follow through, plus pay $165 fee for AODA. Complete OWI court. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CF10 Ct. 1- Impose and stay: 6 years WSPS, 3 years IC, 3 years ES. 3 years probation, concurrent to 15CM700 Ct. 1. Complete OWI court. Pay $600 fine plus cc. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. 3 years drivers license revocation, concurrent to 15CM700 Ct. 1, granted administrative credit for any time already served. 3 years IID to be installed immediately, concurrent to 15CM700 Ct. 1, time will not begin until obtain's valid license. AODA assessment with follow through. 1 year jail, 90 days of time I/S for rule violations. 213 days credit towards 9 months, huber for work, school, treatment if meets jail criteria. Half price IID granted.
Adj: 3:08pm

BOTR: 3:52pm
Appearances: Atty Brubacher and Atty Mort.

COURT did not address programming for WSPS.
State says deft would be eligible for substance abuse programming and not eligible for challenge incarceration programming due to age of deft
Atty Mort in agreement with programming
Adj: 3:53pm

unable to forward

unable to forward

Case Called: 11:04 am
Includes 15CM700, 15CM1070, 15CM1077.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in custody and with Atty Austin Mort.
Date and time set for a Plea Hearing. 
Parties address the possibility of OWI Court for the Defendant.

OTR: 11:12 am
BOTR: 11:17 am
Atty Mort makes statement regarding the Defense recommendation.
ADA Brubacher makes statement.
COURT addresses the parties and finds that Defendant would benefit from the OWI treatment. 

Parties adjourn the matter for today and are to reschedule with the JA.

Adj: 11:27 am

Case Called: 8:32am. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 15CM700, (15CM1070, 15CM1077- Tracking). State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt for ADA Sid Brubacher. Deft appears in custody and with Atty Austin Mort. State recites missed appearance. Atty Mort states Defendant was in hospital etc at the time of pretrial. State does not request Bond Forfeiture. COURT does not forfeit bond. DATES: FPT 7/23/15. Bond to Continue. Adjourned: 8:35am.

Includes 15CM1077 and 15CM1070.    Shall not consume alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 (drugs/alcohol) with day reporting.
